entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character in the story, referred to as 'he' and 'Harry'. The text describes Harry's actions and reactions throughout the conversation with Dumbledore.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: A wise and powerful wizard who is having a conversation with Harry. He is described as having an 'arrested look' on his face.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Harry's godfather, who is also present in the conversation. He asks a question about the Reverse Spell effect.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: The main antagonist of the story, whose wand shares a core with Harry's wand.

entities.name: fawkes
entities.description: A phoenix that is perched on Harry's knee. Its feathers are used in the wands of Harry and Voldemort.

entities.name: olivander
entities.description: A wandmaker who wrote to Dumbledore about Harry buying a second wand.

relationships.description: Harry and Dumbledore are having a conversation about the Reverse Spell effect.
The wands of Harry and Voldemort share cores, each containing a feather from Fawkes' tail.
